page.title: 02LOCATION
page.content: interest, and lies just outside the Peak District National Park. {COUNTRYSIDE }_ Dry stone walls enclose a patchwork of green fields, the thin_ soiled treeless skyline of the steep hills contrasting starkly the softer fertile river valley ln which nestle the two villages, the main road and the railway. Excellent views from high points, such as Hartcliff Hill (approx 1,150 feet above sea level). On a fine day the view stretches for miles across peaceful farmland, with calm reservoirs set among bilberries and heather, and the road snaking across the moorland clad hills. {VEGETATION} Few trees on the hill tops where the soil is thin and it is windy. Some trees lean away from the direction of the wind. Small areas of mature deciduous trees below skyline. {
